An old message, encrypted with RSA using blum integers, hides the city's coordinates. Crack 6660473383559372608749495335817708189324063070793448843205480248209150257193738451618963116484602428737567026982267903495001292810937949783762992619427823 to reveal the secret before rivals do.

The flag format is flag{...}
n=8431650416516514603142307947972064462166931236815304590809078273005759173177987065557574900340841764051127181775631820715703886652067007561424538778957337, e=4654510358831246788693592756698467137260394605840066246497390114514407036104337860053391226645205392466009105964039153055963845303527439087005937162781293
The lower 104 bits of p are: 63916599644840777833829694435479616223

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{mtkcrvgv}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 6660473383559372608749495335817708189324063070793448843205480248209150257193738451618963116484602428737567026982267903495001292810937949783762992619427823
vulnerability: blum integers
hint: Blum integers are products of primes congruent to 3 modulo 4. These integers have unique properties in cryptography.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
